instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
hey all

i have 3.3 coming to u7701 also 5v is there feedback line is good
f7700 has 8.67v but nothing on lcd boost?

please help.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have image for sure?
If yes, post BKLT_EN and BKLT_PWM voltage.
If not, check for USB activity.
Does it chime at least?
Post voltage on both pins of D7701.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
100% got image boot all the way to os. Chimes!
D7701 no power on both ends i checked both traces from u7701 i also change u7701 just in case.
no voltage on d7701 and bklt_en & bklt_pwm

i forgot to mention this was also some waterdamage
3 area affected with visible corrosion:
u5110
u7090
q7560

can this be part of problem?

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message: does lcd connector must be connected for the right reading?

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Of course, LCD must be detected; in order to enable backlight and image...

Post voltages for Q7706/07 too.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
i forgot to try with lcd after u7701 replacement. i ultrasonic and test in machine its all good. everything working perfect.

thanks so much informaticos
